lead_paragraph: The establishment of a temporary Soviet capital at Kuibyshev, or Samara, to give the city its ancient Czarist name, marks the second, but probably not the final, phase of the Russo-German war. The battleline now extends from Leningrad to the Sea of Azov, with a great bulge threatening Moscow in the center and an arm reaching out in the south toward the Caucasus.
